meanings.definition: Having a sharp, biting taste like that of lemon or vinegar.
meanings.sent1: The lemonade was too sour for my liking.
meanings.sent2: The sour candy made my mouth pucker.
meanings.sent3: She made a sour face after tasting the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent4: The news left a sour taste in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The sour grapes made him cringe with every bite.

meanings.sent1: The milk will sour if left out of the fridge.
meanings.sent2: The friendship soured after the argument.
meanings.sent3: His mood began to sour as the day went on.
meanings.sent4: The relationship soured like milk left in the sun.
meanings.sent5: Her expression soured when she heard the news.

meanings.sent1: The chef added a hint of sour to the dish.
meanings.sent2: The drink had a refreshing sourness to it.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected sour in the recipe made it unique.
meanings.sent4: The sour of the fruit balanced the sweetness of the dessert.
meanings.sent5: The sour of the lemon gave the dish a zesty kick.

meanings.definition: To make or become unpleasant or disagreeable.
meanings.sent1: His negative comments soured the mood of the party.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather soured our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The argument soured the atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bad news soured the excitement of the day.
